```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(here)
library(purrr)
library(stringr)
library(tidyr)
```

```{r}
# create a variable 'n' for rows in tmax
n = 7920
# read in temperature data
temperature <- read_tsv(here("data", "tmax.txt"), col_names = TRUE, show_col_types = FALSE) 

# create a normal distribution of age 
age = rnorm(n = n, mean = 50, sd = 10)
# make a data frame of age data
age = as.data.frame(age)

# create a normal distribution of income
income = rnorm(n = n, mean = 65000, sd = 20000)
# make a data frame of income data
income = as.data.frame(income)

# source in temperature risk function
source("../R/temperature_risk.R")

# run function with temp, age, and income
temperature_risk(temperature=temperature$tmax, age=age, income = income)
```
